milestone.description:
**1. Complete initial airdrop functionality**
- Airdrop history screens
- Ability to airdrop based on in-Community activity (No. of msg, No. msg in time range, joining a community, length of community membership)  Ability to combine multiple attributes into an airdrop
- Ability to token gate airdrops
- Live airdrop gas estimation when setting up airdrop

**2. Community Admin functionality enhancements**
- optional service to once a month auto-kick all members who haven't been online for between 30 and 60 days (e.g. auto-kick members whose profile information like Name, Avatar, etc... can no longer be fetched)

**3.  IPFS service for community minted NFTs and other binary community assets**

- In order for NFT tokens minted in our UI to be correctly displayed with all metadata on OpenSea, their assets need to be stored in IPFS (because IPFS is supported by OpenSea)

- Will work something like this: IPFS pinning server is integrated into Status Desktop. When a community mints a NFT, the associated assets are IPFS pinned by the community control node.  The community control node then sends a 'user invisible message' to all other community members via Waku, and the Status Desktop installs of all community members then fetch the NFT assets and pin them as well.  This means that every member of a community that is running Status Desktop will always be 'IPFS pinning' all assets related to the community, so that as long as one community member that uses Status Desktop is online, the assets are guaranteed to be available via IPFS.

- Use a similar scheme to the above could be used for other community assets (that are not related to token minting) in the future like: Community banner image, community icon, community description, etc...

- Use a similar scheme to the above could be used for status user data in the future.  Status users pin assets related to their profile (banner image, avatar, showcase contents) using IPFS, and all of the user's mutual contacts also pin that user's profile data.  Must incorporate a setting so that users can opt-out of pinning their mutual contact's profile data.

**4. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)


**5. Telegram history import into a single channel in an existing community**


**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

2. Advanced transaction signing

body:
using 0.11.1

**here's our current copy for keycard settings** 
https://www.figma.com/file/idUoxN7OIW2Jpp3PMJ1Rl8/%E2%9A%99%EF%B8%8F-Settings-%7C-Desktop?type=design&node-id=199%3A2653&t=OJFATDkeg77doQal-1
![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/11461437/2f19c6ee-40fc-4f16-8633-d9ff52e73c7d)

for new users, these different wordings create significant cognitive load to understand. 

**here's a suggestion for your review of a simpler copy** @xAlisher @benjthayer 

Migrate an existing account to a new keycard
**Create a new keycard account**
Generate mnemonic words
Import mnemonic words
From an existing keycard
**Other**
Check what’s on a keycard
Factory reset a keycard


------

@saledjenic please do not implement before review and confirmation from @benjthayer & @xAlisher

Hey @alaibe we will be putting in effort to optimise the usability of the Keycard flows when we look at them for mobile so we were thinking then would be a good time to review the copy here. 

A couple of thoughts on the proposed copy in the meantime:

- Its generally best to make each menu item fully comprehensible without the context of the subtitle. So copy that leads on from the subtitle may not be optimal - the user may read the option first then have to track back to the subtitle (which they likely skipped over in the first instance) in order to understand the option - for eg with the option `From an existing Keycard`

- We are using `seed phrase` throughout the desktop app as opposed to `mnemonic phrase` so it would be best to stick to that phrasing for now for consistency perhaps. I believe the mobile app is using `recovery phrase` so as we approach the launch of the new mobile app it would be worth us auditing and aligning the desktop terminology in this regard with the mobile app.

I'd need a bit of dedicated time to look at the rewording so may need to look at prioritisation with @John-44

Just want to mention one other aspect we've discussed which @guylouis pointed out during that meeting. There are some flows where we're considering the keycard as an empty keycard if it has no metadata even it has seed phrase stored and in such cases we just don't let user to proceed further. I don't know by heart what are those flows and we surely need to review them all what @guylouis will do after 0.13.0 release.

Some examples we've discussed then:
- "Factory reset a Keycard" flow should be accessible for all non empty keycards (regardless they contain only seed phrase or seed phrase + metadata) - it's like that now
- "Check what’s on a Keycard" flow should be accessible only for all keycards which contain metadata, no point in proceeding with this flow for other keycards' states (empty or without metadata) - it's like that now
- "Create a backup copy of this Keycard" flow should be accessible for all non empty keycards, but at the moment we don't let user to create a copy of a Keycard if that keycard has no metadata.

Though I am not sure for the last case that we should allow user to make a copy of a Keycard without metadata, even that's kinda expected by the keycard team, cause that ruins the design. How would this look if we would allow keycards without metadata (somehow incomplete)?
